English: Two years ago
It was the year of 1978.\nI had enlisted to the US Army to keep families traditions, however I had no idea that I came in the wrong time to the wrong place.

The first meeting with our training location - The Republic of Everon hadn't belonged to my best.\nPreviously I am Russian and at that time my accent was as bad as the world itself\n So what I have actually expected in this world of rivality?
What is it? Move your ass and keep going! Move!
Sir, yes, sir!
Twombly!

Ok, ladies! I am your training leader sergeant Derek Muday!
Now you are going to do what I want to do!
You will perspire your blood if I will want!
You will set up your ass to me if I will want and I will kill you if I will fucking want!
Why you're fucking starring on me! Are you gay, or what!
Answer me, you russian fucker!
Sir, no, sir!
Bullshit! You\re fucking with me! 100 pushupps! Now!  Come on, you son of bitch! Move it, move it, move it!
Sir, of course, sir!
But it wasn't the worst what I used to experience.
The Soviet troops seized an old abandoned island in the Pacific - Kolguev and set up a massive military base.
Washington didn't want to be behind\nand few days later established the military protection of Malden against the Russians.

Everon was the sole island without a major power protection.\nBecause the Everon's government was afraid of the Soviet expansion and therefore decided to request the White House for help.\nThe world tensiuon was increasing.

President Jimmy Carter planned the same process that was used on Malden -\ncreate the same massive modern military presence as the Russians on Kolguev, but Everon wasn't like Malden.\nIts people wanted protection like Malden, but also democracy, freedom and no interferring in their affairs.
But nothing of this sort did happen. Instead, barracks were built...
Training camps...
Ports...
Firing ranges... and more...

Although my military drilling wasn't the worst, the storm was coming.
The people of Everon did not want us. They wanted their freedom with soldiers behind their backs, not in front of them.
The desired military protection, but we gave them occupartion.
With our reign the island wasn't peaceful and beautiful anymore, but tension was growing and war was in the air.
Because our military presence did not mean help for the Eveon's people,
but it served just for our goals, as well as in politics and in world power.
The Unrest has begun.
Jean! Jean!
What's happening?
Come on, Twombly! Move your fucking russian fat ass! Move! Move! Move!
Gentlemen, I'm glad you're here. Today it's going to beghin.
We are ready and wainting for your orders, Jean!
Vivat la Resistance!
Fire!
Fuck... it's jamned! I cannot shot, sir!
You are making me happy, Twombly. Well done, boy...
